content.1: And all the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.
content.2: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!
content.4: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt.
content.5: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
content.6: And Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh,
content.7: And they spake unto all the company of the children of Israel, saying, The land, which we passed through to search it,
content.9: Only rebel not ye against the
content.10: But all the congregation bade stone them with stones. And the glory of the
content.12: I will smite them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of thee a greater nation and mightier than they.
content.17: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
content.19: Pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.
content.22: Because all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempted me now these ten times, and have not hearkened to my voice;
content.23: Surely they shall not see the land which I sware unto their fathers, neither shall any of them that provoked me see it:
content.24: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and hath followed me fully, him will I bring into the land whereinto he went; and his seed shall possess it.
content.25: (Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwelt in the valley.) To morrow turn you, and get you into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.
content.29: Your carcases shall fall in this wilderness; and all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, which have murmured against me,
content.30: Doubtless ye shall not come into the land,
content.31: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.
content.33: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.
content.34: After the number of the days in which ye searched the land,
content.36: And the men, which Moses sent to search the land, who returned, and made all the congregation to murmur against him, by bringing up a slander upon the land,
content.37: Even those men that did bring up the evil report upon the land, died by the plague before the
content.38: But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh,
content.39: And Moses told these sayings unto all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly.
content.40: And they rose up early in the morning, and gat them up into the top of the mountain, saying, Lo, we
content.41: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the
content.43: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites
content.44: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the
content.45: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites which dwelt in that hill, and smote them, and discomfited them,
